question: A ball of mass 0.2kg is thrown vertically down from a height of 10m. It collides with the floor and loses 50% of its energy and then rises back to the same height. The value of its initial velocity is
explanation: Let initial velocity be <katex>$v_0$</katex>. Energy at impact <katex>$E_1 = \frac{1}{2}mv_0^2 + mgh$</katex>. After losing 50%, energy is <katex>$0.5 E_1$</katex>. This energy is sufficient to rise to height <katex>$h$</katex>. So <katex>$0.5(\frac{1}{2}mv_0^2 + mgh) = mgh$</katex>. <katex>$\frac{1}{2}mv_0^2 + mgh = 2mgh$</katex>. <katex>$\frac{1}{2}v_0^2 = gh$</katex>. <katex>$v_0 = \sqrt{2gh} = \sqrt{2 \times 10 \times 10} = 14.14$</katex> m/s. Approx 14 m/s.
